messages.content:
You are tasked with adding English translations to a set of stakeholder quotes. For each quote:
- If the quote is in English, add "N.A." as the translation
- If the quote is in any other language, provide an accurate English translation

Input format is a markdown table with stakeholder names and quotes.
Output should be a markdown table with three columns: name, original quote, and translation.

IMPORTANT RULES:
- Never translate English quotes to English - use "N.A." instead.
- Only and always translate non-English quotes.
- If the original quote, in the third column of the md table is not in english, translate it and add the translation in the 4th column, as described below, but that is only when the quote is not in English.
- Keep original quotes exactly as they are.
- Maintain the markdown table format, without including any horizontal divider lines

Example input:
| Pierre Dupont | Consumer | "Cette décision est importante." |
| John Smith | Fortescue's corporate lawyer | "We need to review this carefully." |

Example output:
| Pierre Dupont | Consumer | "Cette décision est importante." | "This decision is important." |
| John Smith | Fortescue's corporate lawyer | "We need to review this carefully." | N.A. |

Example input:
| [Person Name 1] | Person Role 1 | [Original Quote in another language (e.g. Dutch, French, German, Spanish,eyc..)] |
| [person Name 2] | Person Role 2 | [Original Quote in English] |

Example output:
| [person Name 1] | Person Role 1 | [Original Quote in another language (e.g. Dutch, French, German, Spanish,etc..)] | [Translated Quote] |
| [person Name 2] | Person Role 2 | [Original Quote in English] | N.A. |

If the input is "None", return "None". if the original quote is not in English, make sure it is translated. Add "N.A" if the quote is already in English.

Input quotes:
| Andrew Forrest | Founder of Fortescue | "The time to invest is through the cycle. If you wait for a boom to invest, you're going to be bringing your product on in a bust." |
| Andrew Forrest | Founder of Fortescue | "I wouldn't change anything about the government's commitment." |
| Alan Finkel | Former Chief Scientist | "We need to get the costs down eventually towards the costs of existing iron and steel making." |
| Ted O'Brien | Opposition Climate and Energy Spokesman | "We remain optimistic about the success of hydrogen in the long term playing a role in our future energy mix but we will not follow Labor's mistake of putting all its eggs in one basket." |
| Fiona Simon | Chief Executive of Australian Hydrogen Council | "(It) confirms what we've all been talking about for a while, which is that it's really hard to get hydrogen projects up. But ... it doesn't mean that all projects don't work." |
| Rod Sims | Chair of Superpower Institute | "We've got the renewable energy sources to make green hydrogen. That's why Australia is the best place in the world to make green iron." |

| Andrew Forrest | Founder of Fortescue | "The time to invest is through the cycle. If you wait for a boom to invest, you're going to be bringing your product on in a bust." | N.A. |
| Andrew Forrest | Founder of Fortescue | "I wouldn't change anything about the government's commitment." | N.A. |
| Alan Finkel | Former Chief Scientist | "We need to get the costs down eventually towards the costs of existing iron and steel making." | N.A. |
| Ted O'Brien | Opposition Climate and Energy Spokesman | "We remain optimistic about the success of hydrogen in the long term playing a role in our future energy mix but we will not follow Labor's mistake of putting all its eggs in one basket." | N.A. |
| Fiona Simon | Chief Executive of Australian Hydrogen Council | "(It) confirms what we've all been talking about for a while, which is that it's really hard to get hydrogen projects up. But ... it doesn't mean that all projects don't work." | N.A. |
| Rod Sims | Chair of Superpower Institute | "We've got the renewable energy sources to make green hydrogen. That's why Australia is the best place in the world to make green iron." | N.A. |
